authors: Xiaoman Wei, Xiang Li, Jie Cui
title: Evolutionary perspectives on novel <b>coronaviruses</b> identified in pneumonia cases in China
abstract:
Coronaviruses, such as severe acute
respiratory syndrome coronavirus
(SARSCoV) and Middle East respiratory
syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV), are
highly transmissible pathogens, and they
can be lethal in humans. Bats are believed
to be the original sources of these lethal
pathogens. In December 2019, a cluster
of pneumonia cases was reported in
Wuhan and a novel coronavirus
(2019nCoV, now oficially named as
SARSCoV-2) has been linked to the causative
agent. Early studies indicated that the
new virus was genetically similar to a bat
betacoronavirus, providing evidence for
bat origin of the third human-infecting
coronavirus in less than 20 years. We here
highlight the potential for viral spillover
from animals to humans and discuss
evolutionary mechanisms leading to the
outbreaks.
